mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn134:2.2.en: “Mendicant, do you remember the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night?”

mn134:2.6.pli: Dhāresi pana tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattiyo gāthā”ti?
mn134:2.6.en: But do you remember just the verses on the one who has one fine night?”

mn134:2.10.pli: “Yathā kathaṁ pana tvaṁ, āvuso, dhāresi bhaddekarattiyo gāthā”ti?
mn134:2.10.en: “How do you remember the verses on the one who has one fine night?”

mn134:2.12.pli: Tatra bhagavā devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsi:
mn134:2.12.en: There he taught the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night to the gods of the thirty-three:

mn134:3.15.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mn134:4.1.pli: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhikkhu, dhāremi bhaddekarattiyo gāthā.
mn134:4.1.en: That’s how I remember the verses of the one who has one fine night.

mn134:4.2.pli: Uggaṇhāhi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca;
mn134:4.2.en: Learn the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night, mendicant,

mn134:5.28.pli: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca desetū”ti.
mn134:5.28.en: “Sir, please teach me the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.”

mn134:7.15.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 134
Lomasakaṅgiya and One Fine Night

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn132:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca bhāsati.
mn132:2.1.en: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants in the assembly hall with a Dhamma talk on the topic of the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.

mn132:2.4.pli: “ko nu kho, bhikkhave, upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsī”ti?
mn132:2.4.en: “Who was inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night?”

mn132:2.7.pli: “yathā kathaṁ pana tvaṁ, ānanda, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsī”ti?
mn132:2.7.en: “But in what way were you inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night?”

mn132:3.16.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mn132:10.15.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mn132:11.1.pli: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesiṁ samādapesiṁ samuttejesiṁ sampahaṁsesiṁ, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsin”ti.
mn132:11.1.en: That’s how I was inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.”

mn132:11.3.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, ānanda, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsi:
mn132:11.3.en: It’s good that you were inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.”

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 132
Ānanda and One Fine Night

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn133:2.1.en: “Mendicant, do you remember the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night?”

mn133:2.5.pli: Dhāresi pana tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattiyo gāthā”ti?
mn133:2.5.en: But do you remember just the verses on the one who has one fine night?”

mn133:2.9.pli: Uggaṇhāhi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca;
mn133:2.9.en: Learn the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night, mendicant,

mn133:4.15.pli: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca desetū”ti.
mn133:4.15.en: “Sir, please teach me the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.”

mn133:5.15.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mn133:12.4.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 133
Mahākaccāna and One Fine Night

mn131:2.1.en: “I shall teach you the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.

mn131:3.15.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mn131:10.15.en: that’s who has one fine night—

mn131:11.1.en: And that’s what I meant when I said: ‘I shall teach you the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.’”
